agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
taxonomy_name: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering public transportation services and recreational activities for area seniors.
service_description: Offers recreational and social activities for seniors. Bingo, card games, art classes, and dancing are regularly offered. Other events and programs may include travel opportunities and outreach projects. Activities and events vary each month.
site_details: Walk in, call, or visit the website for an event and activities schedule.
site_eligibility: Age 55 or older

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to those in need. Cleaning and hygiene products are also sometimes available. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living within the boundaries of Rossville School Corporation -- Limit one visit per week

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides community outreach.
service_description: Offers limited financial assistance (up to $30) for rent, medical co-pays, and utility bills pending disconnection to eligible families. Assistance is determined on a case-by-case basis.
site_details: Walk in for an assessment.
site_schedule: Mon-Fri 9am-3:30pm -- Intake: Mon, Wed, and Fri 9am-noon and 1pm-3pm
site_eligibility: With demonstrated financial need (based on assessment) -- Not received financial assistance within the past 6 months

agency_name: BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB OF CLINTON COUNTY
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering social enrichment and educational activities for youth.
site_name: BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB OF CLINTON COUNTY
service_description: Provides supervised enrichment opportunities after school and over the summer for area youth. Programs emphasize character and leadership, education and career development, the arts, life skills, health and fitness, sports, and recreation.
site_details: Call or walk in for more information, or download an application from website.
site_schedule: School Year: Mon-Fri 3pm-6pm -- Summer Clubs: Mon-Fri 6:45am-6pm
site_eligibility: Boys and girls ages 5-18; some Pre-K sports available for nonmembers

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Clinton County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Clinton County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions
site_details: Call for assistance.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 9am
Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: Monthly 1st and 3rd Mon 9am
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_name: COMMUNITY HOWARD REGIONAL HEALTH COUNSELING CENTER
service_description: Provides individual, family, and group counseling for all ages. Psychiatrists are staffed on site. Other support services include prescription assistance, case management, referrals to inpatient services, and substance abuse counseling. Sliding-scale fee options are available.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment; same-day scheduling.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Clinton County.
service_description: Responds during a disaster or large-scale emergency in Clinton County, assists with the recovery efforts afterwards, and takes steps to prevent or lessen the effects of future disasters. Offers sandbags to Clinton County households during times of flooding.
site_details: Call for information. For emergency assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_schedule: Mon, Tues, Wed, and Fri 8am-4pm; Thurs 8am-noon; on call for emergencies: Daily 24 Hours

service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to those in need. Open service area.

agency_name: FRANKFORT FIRST CHURCH OF THE NAZARENE
agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
site_name: FRANKFORT FIRST CHURCH OF THE NAZARENE
service_description: Provides nonperishable food to those in need. Toilet paper and personal grooming supplies are also often available, depending on donations. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in; pantry is located in the Community Life Center behind the main church building.
site_eligibility: Living within the Frankfort area -- Limit one visit every 30 days

agency_desc: A nonprofit humane society contracted to provide animal control services for Clinton County.
service_description: Accepts donations of pet food and supplies for shelter use. Needed items often include cat and dog food, blankets, towels, cleaning supplies. Volunteers to assist with shelter duties, including cleaning are also welcome.
site_details: Walk in to make donation arrangements or to inquire about volunteering.
site_schedule: Tues, Thurs, and Sat noon-4pm; Fri noon-5pm
Tues, Thurs, and Sat noon-4pm; Fri noon-5pm
Shelter: Tues, Thurs and Sat noon-4pm; Fri noon-5pm -- Animal Control Dispatch: Daily 24 hours for emergencies
Shelter: Tues, Thurs and Sat noon-4pm; Fri noon-5pm -- Animal Control Dispatch: Daily 24 hours for emergencies

Shelter: Tues, Thurs and Sat noon-4pm; Fri noon-5pm -- Animal Control Dispatch: Daily 24 hours for emergencies
site_eligibility: To Donate: Open -- To Volunteer: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Provides governance and municipal services. Responds to questions, complaints, and requests regarding town government and services.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Provides street and sidewalk maintenance, storm-sewer maintenance, snow and ice control, dead animal pick-up, street-sign maintenance, and grounds keeping of public properties.
site_details: Call for information, to submit a request, or to make a report.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Maintains and provides information about public park facilities. Programs vary by season, but may include team sports, summer youth clubs, and after-school programs.
site_details: Walk in to visit the parks; call or visit the website for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services.
service_description: Provides electric, water, and sanitary sewer utility services for the city of Frankfort in Clinton County.
site_details: Call for assistance. Bills may be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is located at this address.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and trains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides low-cost tuberculosis (TB) testing to persons required to take the test for work, school, or other programs as well as for those with known exposure or high risk factors.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_schedule: Mon and Fri noon-5pm; Tues and Thurs 10am-5pm; Wed noon-5:30pm; Sat 10am-3pm
Mon and Fri noon-5pm; Tues and Thurs 10am-5pm; Wed noon-5:30pm; Sat 10am-3pm
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in the town of Kirklin or Kirklin Township in Clinton County

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the town of Kirklin in Clinton County.
service_description: Provides trash pick-up, water, and sanitary sewer utility services for the town of Kirklin in Clinton County.
site_details: Call or walk in for assistance. Bills may be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is located at this address.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Thurs 8am-4:30pm; Fri 8am-noon -- Parks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Kirklin

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a program for financial assistance.
service_description: Provides limited financial assistance for rent and utilities to people in need. Persons seeking financial assistance must first apply with their township Trustee. Approved applicants  typically receive assistance in 10-14 days.
site_details: Walk in to complete an application with the required documentation.
site_eligibility: Living in the city of Frankfort -- Having a low-income or financial need -- Applied for assistance from township trustee

agency_name: SOCIETY OF SAINT VINCENT DE PAUL - FRANKFORT
agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides limited emergency financial assistance for rent and/or utilities. Must have completed the trustee application process before applying for financial assistance.
site_details: Call and leave a voicemail for a return call.
site_eligibility: Living in Clinton County -- Must have applied through township trustee prior to requesting financial assistance

agency_name: FIRST CHRISTIAN CHURCH - DISCIPLES OF CHRIST
agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including limited financial assistance.
site_name: FIRST CHRISTIAN CHURCH - DISCIPLES OF CHRIST
service_description: Provides limited financial assistance (up to $25) for rent or utility bills to eligible households that have exhausted other area programs. Assistance is determined on a case-by-case basis and limited to one time per household each year.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Applied for assistance from township trustee and Salvation Army -- Not received funds from this church within the past year

agency_desc: A community food pantry provided by Gloria Dei Lutheran Church, Mulberry United Methodist Church, and Trinity Church of Mulberry serving Madison Township of Clinton County.
service_description: Provides free nonperishable food, bar and laundry soap, shampoo, and dish soap to those in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in and present ID and sign in; first-time visitors will also need to complete a registration form.
site_eligibility: Living in Madison Township of Clinton County -- Limit one visit per calendar month

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach programs, included limited financial assistance.
service_description: Provides limited financial assistance (up to $50) for rent deposits, rent payments, utility deposits, and past-due utility bills to eligible Clinton County households that have exhausted other area programs. Assistance is determined on a case-by-case basis and limited to one time per household every six months. Same-day service is not available.
site_details: Call to request an appointment and complete a phone assessment.
site_eligibility: Applied for assistance from the township trustee, Salvation Army, and Area IV -- Not received funds from this church within the past 6 months

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a financial assistance program.
service_description: Provides limited financial assistance (up to $50) for rent payments, rent deposits, and utility bills to those in need who have exhausted other area programs.
site_details: Call or walk in to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Applied with the township trustee, Salvation Army, and Area IV (if during Energy Assistance season) -- Not received assistance from this church within past six (6) months

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Clinton County.
service_description: Maintains the Clinton County correctional institution used to detain persons who are in lawful custody, including accused persons awaiting trial and those who have been convicted of a crime and are serving a sentence of less than one year.
site_details: Call or visit the website for scheduling details.
site_eligibility: To visit: Must be on the inmate's approved visitor list -- Age 18 or older (or accompanied by someone over 18 who is also on the inmate's visitor list)

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services for county roadways in Clinton County.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Clinton County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. -- To report urgent problems after hours, call Clinton County dispatch.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Clinton County)

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Clinton County -- Veterans and surviving spouses and children of veterans

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Clinton County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Varies; call for details.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Clinton County.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana KIDS Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Clinton County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials in Clinton County. This court also hears cases related to traffic violations in Clinton County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves. For juror information, contact the court.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials including petitions for emancipation, children in need of services (CHINS), and minors accused of delinquency or status offenses.
site_details: Circuit Court: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves. For juror information, contact the court.Juvenille Court: By court order; parents cannot self-refer children to juvenile court
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court; Clinton County juveniles age 17 and younger.

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Clinton County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile and adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the probation office; call for information.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Clinton County Circuit and Superior Courts

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Clinton County, the Superior Court handles small claims cases.
site_details: Walk in or visit the website for claim forms. -- Call for information about marriage ceremonies.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Clinton County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Clinton County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Clinton County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Frankfort in Clinton County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of Frankfort in Clinton County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call city dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the city of Frankfort in Clinton County.
service_description: Provides free smoke alarms to household in need, when funds are available.
site_details: Call to request smoke alarm.
site_eligibility: Homeowners living in the city of Frankfort in Clinton County -- Financial need

agency_name: HEALTHY COMMUNITIES OF CLINTON COUNTY COALITION
agency_desc: A nonprofit coalition addressing health and environmental issues in Clinton County through educational outreach and programs.
site_name: HEALTHY COMMUNITIES OF CLINTON COUNTY COALITION
service_description: Offers free health screenings (including blood pressure, blood sugar, BMI/Body Composition Screening, and education on nutrition and health) to those living in Clinton County.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit faith-based organization promoting positive influences and personal growth through community mentoring programs in Clinton County.
service_description: Facilitates the screening, training, and matching of adult volunteers for a variety of mentoring opportunities in Clinton County. Prospective mentors must be interviewed, undergo background and reference checks, and complete online Child Safety Training.
site_details: Visit website, call, or walk into the office for a volunteer mentor application.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Thurs 9am-3pm -- Volunteer Activity: Varies based on program and activity
Mon-Thurs 9am-3pm; evening and weekend appointments may also be available
site_eligibility: Age 21 or older -- With dependable transportation -- Able to pass a criminal background check -- Willing to commit to required training and regular mentoring sessions

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network with a Catholic perspective offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services throughout central and southern Indiana.
service_description: Offers a private, full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
site_details: Walk in for emergency care. -- Call for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_schedule: Mon and Wed 11am-6pm; Tues and Thurs 12:30pm-6:30pm; Fri 11am-5pm; Sat 9am-2pm
Mon and Wed 11am-6pm; Tues and Thurs 12:30pm-6:30pm; Fri 11am-5pm; Sat 9am-2pm
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- For a library card: Living in Colfax or Perry Townships

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering various education programs to those in Clinton County and surrounding areas.
service_description: Offers language instruction for new English speakers, taught at various levels to enhance socialization and reading ability. Students are required to take a placement test to determine level of literacy in the English language. Morning and evening class times are available. Child care is provided for a nominal fee.
site_details: Call or walk in for information. An orientation is required.
site_eligibility: Beginning to intermediate English speakers

agency_desc: A nonprofit community health organization offering health care and dental services.
site_name: RIGGS COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER - CLINTON COUNTY
service_description: Offers comprehensive primary health care services to patients age 3 or older.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 3 or older

agency_desc: Offers career and technical education programs, adult education, high school equivalency, and English as a new language classes, and provides a test site for the high school equivalency exam.
service_description: Offers free instruction in basic reading, math, language arts, technology, life skills, and job readiness as well as preparation for the high school equivalency test.
site_details: Call or visit website to enroll. -- Visit website for location details.
site_eligibility: Age 16 or older -- Not enrolled in high school (documentation required for age 16-17 years-old)

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- To check out materials: Resident library card or Public Library Access Card (PLAC) -- For a resident library card: Living in Clinton County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- To check out materials: Resident library card or Public Library Access Card (PLAC) -- For a resident library card: Living in Clinton County

service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.

Mon, Wed, and Fri 9am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 1pm-7pm; Sat 10am-2pm
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- To check out materials: Resident library card or Public Library Access Card (PLAC) -- For a resident library card: Living in Clinton County

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.
site_schedule: Mon, Wed, Fri 9am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 1pm-7pm; Sat 10am-2pm
Mon, Wed, Fri 9am-5pm; Tues and Thurs 1pm-7pm; Sat 10am-2pm
